106class ScriptObject
107{
108 friend class ScriptMgr;
109
110public:
111 // Do not override this in scripts; it should be overridden by the various script type classes. It indicates
112 // whether or not this script type must be assigned in the database.
113 [[nodiscard]] virtual bool IsDatabaseBound() const { return false; }
114 [[nodiscard]] virtual bool isAfterLoadScript() const { return IsDatabaseBound(); }
115 virtual void checkValidity() { }
116
117 [[nodiscard]] const std::string& GetName() const { return _name; }
118
119protected:
120 ScriptObject(const char* name)
121 : _name(std::string(name))
122 {
123 }
124
125 virtual ~ScriptObject() = default;
126
127private:
128 const std::string _name;
129};
130
131template<class TObject> class UpdatableScript
132{
133protected:
134 UpdatableScript() = default;
135
136public:
137 virtual void OnUpdate(TObject* /*obj*/, uint32 /*diff*/) { }
138};
139
140class SpellScriptLoader : public ScriptObject
141{
142protected:
143 SpellScriptLoader(const char* name);
144
145public:
146 [[nodiscard]] bool IsDatabaseBound() const override { return true; }
147
148 // Should return a fully valid SpellScript pointer.
149 [[nodiscard]] virtual SpellScript* GetSpellScript() const { return nullptr; }
150
151 // Should return a fully valid AuraScript pointer.
152 [[nodiscard]] virtual AuraScript* GetAuraScript() const { return nullptr; }
153};

155class ServerScript : public ScriptObject
156{
157protected:
158 ServerScript(const char* name);
159
160public:
161 // Called when reactive socket I/O is started (WorldSocketMgr).
162 virtual void OnNetworkStart() { }
163
164 // Called when reactive I/O is stopped.
165 virtual void OnNetworkStop() { }
166
167 // Called when a remote socket establishes a connection to the server. Do not store the socket object.
168 virtual void OnSocketOpen(std::shared_ptr<WorldSocket> /*socket*/) { }
169
170 // Called when a socket is closed. Do not store the socket object, and do not rely on the connection
171 // being open; it is not.
172 virtual void OnSocketClose(std::shared_ptr<WorldSocket> /*socket*/) { }
173
181 [[nodiscard]] virtual bool CanPacketSend(WorldSession* /*session*/, WorldPacket& /*packet*/) { return true; }
182
191 [[nodiscard]] virtual bool CanPacketReceive(WorldSession* /*session*/, WorldPacket& /*packet*/) { return true; }
192};

194class WorldScript : public ScriptObject

197 WorldScript(const char* name);

204 virtual void OnAfterConfigLoad(bool /*reload*/) { }
205
206 // Called when loading custom database tables
207 virtual void OnLoadCustomDatabaseTable() { }
208
209 // Called before the world configuration is (re)loaded.
210 virtual void OnBeforeConfigLoad(bool /*reload*/) { }

218 // Called when a world shutdown is cancelled.
219 virtual void OnShutdownCancel() { }

245 virtual void OnBeforeWorldInitialized() { }

282template<class TMap> class MapScript : public UpdatableScript<TMap>
283{
284 MapEntry const* _mapEntry;
285 uint32 _mapId;
286
287protected:
288 MapScript(uint32 mapId)
289 : _mapId(mapId)
290 {
291 }
292
293public:
294 void checkMap()
295 {
296 _mapEntry = sMapStore.LookupEntry(_mapId);
297
298 if (!_mapEntry)
299 LOG_ERROR("maps.script", "Invalid MapScript for {}; no such map ID.", _mapId);
300 }
301
302 // Gets the MapEntry structure associated with this script. Can return nullptr.
303 MapEntry const* GetEntry() { return _mapEntry; }
304
305 // Called when the map is created.
306 virtual void OnCreate(TMap* /*map*/) { }
307
308 // Called just before the map is destroyed.
309 virtual void OnDestroy(TMap* /*map*/) { }
310
311 // Called when a grid map is loaded.
312 virtual void OnLoadGridMap(TMap* /*map*/, GridMap* /*gmap*/, uint32 /*gx*/, uint32 /*gy*/) { }
313
314 // Called when a grid map is unloaded.
315 virtual void OnUnloadGridMap(TMap* /*map*/, GridMap* /*gmap*/, uint32 /*gx*/, uint32 /*gy*/) { }
316
317 // Called when a player enters the map.
318 virtual void OnPlayerEnter(TMap* /*map*/, Player* /*player*/) { }
319
320 // Called when a player leaves the map.
321 virtual void OnPlayerLeave(TMap* /*map*/, Player* /*player*/) { }
322
323 // Called on every map update tick.
324 void OnUpdate(TMap* /*map*/, uint32 /*diff*/) override { }
325};
326
327class WorldMapScript : public ScriptObject, public MapScript<Map>
328{
329protected:
330 WorldMapScript(const char* name, uint32 mapId);
331
332public:
333 [[nodiscard]] bool isAfterLoadScript() const override { return true; }
334
335 void checkValidity() override
336 {
337 checkMap();
338
339 if (GetEntry() && !GetEntry()->IsWorldMap())
340 LOG_ERROR("maps.script", "WorldMapScript for map {} is invalid.", GetEntry()->MapID);
341 }
342};
343
344class InstanceMapScript : public ScriptObject, public MapScript<InstanceMap>
345{
346protected:
347 InstanceMapScript(const char* name, uint32 mapId);
348
349public:
350 [[nodiscard]] bool IsDatabaseBound() const override { return true; }
351
352 void checkValidity() override
353 {
354 checkMap();
355
356 if (GetEntry() && !GetEntry()->IsDungeon())
357 LOG_ERROR("maps.script", "InstanceMapScript for map {} is invalid.", GetEntry()->MapID);
358 }
359
360 // Gets an InstanceScript object for this instance.
361 virtual InstanceScript* GetInstanceScript(InstanceMap* /*map*/) const { return nullptr; }
362};

765 // Called when a player opens a gossip dialog with the gameobject.

2601namespace Acore::SpellScripts
2602{
2603 template<typename T>
2604 using is_SpellScript = std::is_base_of<SpellScript, T>;

2610template <typename... Ts>
2611class GenericSpellAndAuraScriptLoader : public SpellScriptLoader
2612{
2613 using SpellScriptType = typename Acore::find_type_if_t<Acore::SpellScripts::is_SpellScript, Ts...>;
2614 using AuraScriptType = typename Acore::find_type_if_t<Acore::SpellScripts::is_AuraScript, Ts...>;
2615 using ArgsType = typename Acore::find_type_if_t<Acore::is_tuple, Ts...>;
2616
2617public:
2618 GenericSpellAndAuraScriptLoader(char const* name, ArgsType&& args) : SpellScriptLoader(name), _args(std::move(args)) { }
2619
2620private:
2621 [[nodiscard]] SpellScript* GetSpellScript() const override
2622 {
2623 if constexpr (!std::is_same_v<SpellScriptType, Acore::find_type_end>)
2624 {
2625 return Acore::new_from_tuple<SpellScriptType>(_args);
2626 }
2627 else
2628 {
2629 return nullptr;
2630 }
2631 }
2632
2633 [[nodiscard]] AuraScript* GetAuraScript() const override
2634 {
2635 if constexpr (!std::is_same_v<AuraScriptType, Acore::find_type_end>)
2636 {
2637 return Acore::new_from_tuple<AuraScriptType>(_args);
2638 }
2639 else
2640 {
2641 return nullptr;
2642 }
2643 }
2644
2645 ArgsType _args;
2646};
2647
2648#define RegisterSpellScriptWithArgs(spell_script, script_name, ...) new GenericSpellAndAuraScriptLoader<spell_script, decltype(std::make_tuple(__VA_ARGS__))>(script_name, std::make_tuple(__VA_ARGS__))
2649#define RegisterSpellScript(spell_script) RegisterSpellScriptWithArgs(spell_script, #spell_script)
2650#define RegisterSpellAndAuraScriptPairWithArgs(script_1, script_2, script_name, ...) new GenericSpellAndAuraScriptLoader<script_1, script_2, decltype(std::make_tuple(__VA_ARGS__))>(script_name, std::make_tuple(__VA_ARGS__))
2651#define RegisterSpellAndAuraScriptPair(script_1, script_2) RegisterSpellAndAuraScriptPairWithArgs(script_1, script_2, #script_1)

2690#define sScriptMgr ScriptMgr::instance()
2691
2692template<class TScript>
2693class ScriptRegistry
2694{
2695public:
2696 typedef std::map<uint32, TScript*> ScriptMap;
2697 typedef typename ScriptMap::iterator ScriptMapIterator;
2698
2699 typedef std::vector<TScript*> ScriptVector;
2700 typedef typename ScriptVector::iterator ScriptVectorIterator;
2701
2702 // The actual list of scripts. This will be accessed concurrently, so it must not be modified
2703 // after server startup.
2704 static ScriptMap ScriptPointerList;
2705 // After database load scripts
2706 static ScriptVector ALScripts;
2707
2708 static void AddScript(TScript* const script)
2709 {
2710 ASSERT(script);
2711
2712 if (!_checkMemory(script))
2713 return;
2714
2715 if (script->isAfterLoadScript())
2716 {
2717 ALScripts.push_back(script);
2718 }
2719 else
2720 {
2721 script->checkValidity();
2722
2723 // We're dealing with a code-only script; just add it.
2724 ScriptPointerList[_scriptIdCounter++] = script;
2725 sScriptMgr->IncrementScriptCount();
2726 }
2727 }
2728
2729 static void AddALScripts()
2730 {
2731 for(ScriptVectorIterator it = ALScripts.begin(); it != ALScripts.end(); ++it)
2732 {
2733 TScript* const script = *it;
2734
2735 script->checkValidity();
2736
2737 if (script->IsDatabaseBound())
2738 {
2739 if (!_checkMemory(script))
2740 {
2741 return;
2742 }
2743
2744 // Get an ID for the script. An ID only exists if it's a script that is assigned in the database
2745 // through a script name (or similar).
2746 uint32 id = sObjectMgr->GetScriptId(script->GetName().c_str());
2747 if (id)
2748 {
2749 // Try to find an existing script.
2750 TScript const* oldScript = nullptr;
2751 for (auto iterator = ScriptPointerList.begin(); iterator != ScriptPointerList.end(); ++iterator)
2752 {
2753 // If the script names match...
2754 if (iterator->second->GetName() == script->GetName())
2755 {
2756 // ... It exists.
2757 oldScript = iterator->second;
2758 break;
2759 }
2760 }
2761
2762 // If the script is already assigned -> delete it!
2763 if (oldScript)
2764 {
2765 delete oldScript;
2766 }
2767
2768 // Assign new script!
2769 ScriptPointerList[id] = script;
2770
2771 // Increment script count only with new scripts
2772 if (!oldScript)
2773 {
2774 sScriptMgr->IncrementScriptCount();
2775 }
2776 }
2777 else
2778 {
2779 // The script uses a script name from database, but isn't assigned to anything.
2780 if (script->GetName().find("Smart") == std::string::npos)
2781 LOG_ERROR("sql.sql", "Script named '{}' is not assigned in the database.",
2782 script->GetName());
2783 }
2784 }
2785 else
2786 {
2787 // We're dealing with a code-only script; just add it.
2788 ScriptPointerList[_scriptIdCounter++] = script;
2789 sScriptMgr->IncrementScriptCount();
2790 }
2791 }
2792 }
2793
2794 // Gets a script by its ID (assigned by ObjectMgr).
2795 static TScript* GetScriptById(uint32 id)
2796 {
2797 ScriptMapIterator it = ScriptPointerList.find(id);
2798 if (it != ScriptPointerList.end())
2799 return it->second;
2800
2801 return nullptr;
2802 }
2803
2804private:
2805 // See if the script is using the same memory as another script. If this happens, it means that
2806 // someone forgot to allocate new memory for a script.
2807 static bool _checkMemory(TScript* const script)
2808 {
2809 // See if the script is using the same memory as another script. If this happens, it means that
2810 // someone forgot to allocate new memory for a script.
2811 for (ScriptMapIterator it = ScriptPointerList.begin(); it != ScriptPointerList.end(); ++it)
2812 {
2813 if (it->second == script)
2814 {
2815 LOG_ERROR("scripts", "Script '{}' has same memory pointer as '{}'.",
2816 script->GetName(), it->second->GetName());
2817
2818 return false;
2819 }
2820 }
2821
2822 return true;
2823 }
2824
2825 // Counter used for code-only scripts.
2826 static uint32 _scriptIdCounter;
2827};
2828
2829// Instantiate static members of ScriptRegistry.
2830template<class TScript> std::map<uint32, TScript*> ScriptRegistry<TScript>::ScriptPointerList;
2831template<class TScript> std::vector<TScript*> ScriptRegistry<TScript>::ALScripts;
2832template<class TScript> uint32 ScriptRegistry<TScript>::_scriptIdCounter = 0;
2833
2834#endif
